data.title: admin « Penwell Turner Funeral Home
data.text:
Author Archive

Joan Therese (Kellner) Sutter

Wednesday, April 17th, 2013

Joan Therese Sutter, age 8O, of 3114 State Route 61, Crestline, died early Sunday morning at her home after an extended illness. She was born October 24, 1912 in Cleveland, the daughter of Joseph and Johanna (Hoeckel) Kellner.

Mrs. Sutter was a homemaker and a member of Sacred Heart Of Jesus Catholic Church in Bethlehem, Shelby Settlement, where she was a member of the Altar and Rosary Society.

She is survived by a daughter, Rosemary Sutter, of Cleveland; a son and daughter-in-law, Robert J. and Maxine Sutter of Crestline; a grandson, Robert Sutter, Jr. of Maine and 2 granddaughters: Michelle Blaising and Gretchen Stull both of Crestline. 1 great granddaugher, Abigail Nicole Blaising. 1 brother, George Kellner, of Lynhurst, Ohio.

She was preceded in death by her husband, Charles Joseph Sutter, on December 19, 1962 and by two brothers: John and William Kellner.

Calling hours will be on Tuesday from 2-4 and 7-9 P.M. at the Turner Funeral Home where the rosary will be recited at 8:30 P.M. Mass of the resurrection will be celebrated on Wednesday at 11:00 A.M. at the Sacred Heart Of Jesus Catholic Church with her nephew, Father Clement Metzger SJ ,Pastor of Gesu Catholic Church in Toledo, officiating. Burial will be in Sacred Heart Cemetery.

Memorial expressions may be made to the church and left in care of the funeral home.

Posted in Obituaries | No Comments »

Ethel (Pavlik) Sutter

Wednesday, April 17th, 2013

Ethel Pavlik Sutter, age 79, of 18335 Royalton Road, Strongsville, died at 10:30 A.M. Wednesday in South West General Hospital in Middleburgh Heights, Ohio, unexpectedly. She was born October 1, 1914 in Strongsville the daughter of John and Susan (Dojcar) Pavlik.

Mrs. Sutter was a homemaker and a member of St. Joseph’s Catholic Church in Strongsville. She and her late husband helped build the original St. Joseph’s Church and school in Strongsville in the late 1940’s. She sang in the church choir for many years and recently served in the Ministry of Praise. She also was past president of the Berea Seniors and was a volunteer for the American Red Cross Bloodmobile.

Mrs. Sutter is survived by 1 son and daughter-in-law, Richard P. and Kathleen Sutter of Morgantown, West Virginia; 1 brother, Paul Pavlik of Hot Springs, AR; by 3 grandchildren: Jennifer Jones, Paul Sutter, and David Sutter; 3 great grandchildren.

She was preceded in death by her husband, Paul Sutter, in 1969; and by a son, David H. Sutter.

The family will receive friends one-half hour prior to the funeral Mass which will be held on Saturday at 11:00 A.M. at Sacred Heart Catholic Church in Bethlehem, Shelby Settlement, with Father Gary Walters, officiating. Burial will be in Sacred Heart Cemetery.

Memorial expressions may be made to the Sacred Heart Church and left in care of the Turner Funeral Home in Shelby, which is in charge of the funeral arrangements.

Posted in Obituaries | No Comments »

Melvin R. Stough

Wednesday, April 17th, 2013

Melvin R. Stough, age 79, of 73 Auburn Avenue, Shelby, died Monday evening, June 17, 2002 at the Woodlawn Nursing Home in Mansfield.

He was born November 20, 1922 in Shelby, the son of the late Milton R. and Lena (Brinkerhoff) Stough. Mr. Stough was a 1940 graduate of Shelby High School and was an Army veteran of WWII serving in the 475th Military Police Escort Guard. He retired from the Shelby Salesbook Company after 46 years of service. He was a member of the First United Methodist Church and American Legion O’Brien Post #326 in Shelby. He was an avid golfer.

Mr. Stough is survived by 3 daughters: Pamela Jacobs of Shelby, Rebecca Kiser of Columbus, and Susan Price of New Miami, OH; 5 grandchildren: Russell Jacobs, Angela McAtee, Ryan Kiser, Michael Price, and Jeffery Price; 2 great granddaughters: Megan Kiser and Alexandra McAtee.

He was preceded in death by his wife, Doris Jean (Briner) Stough in 2001; a son, David Stough in 1947; and a sister, Marian Welsh in 1989.

Calling hours will be on Thursday, June 20, 2002 from 10-11 AM at the Turner Funeral Home, 168 West Main Street, Shelby. Funeral Services will be held Thursday, at 11 AM at the funeral home with Rev. Jeff Matthews officiating. Burial will be in Oakland Cemetery with military honors conducted by the Shelby American Legion. Memorial expressions may be made to the American Diabetes Association.

Posted in Obituaries | No Comments »

Edward D. Studer

Wednesday, April 17th, 2013

Edward D. Studer, age 87, of 27 Maple Street, Shelby, died early Friday morning January 17, 2003 at Med Central Shelby Hospital.

Mr. Studer was born August 15, 1915 in New Washington, Ohio the son of the late Donatus and Esther Studer. He was an Army veteran of WWII and retired from Westinghouse in Mansfield after 42 years of service. He was a member of Most Pure Heart of Mary Catholic Church and a former member of the Shelby Moose Lodge. He enjoyed woodworking and gardening.

Ed is survived by his wife, Anna M. (Alt) Studer, whom he wed on November 28, 1946; 3 sons and 2 daughters-in-law, Larry Studer of Salem, OR, James and Jeannine Studer of Huron, OH and Dennis and Lorraine Studer of Galena, OH; 3 grandchildren, Sean Studer of San Diego, CA, Erin Studer of Bowling Green, OH and Dena Studer of Galena, OH; 3 brothers and 4 sisters-in-law, Paul and Rita Studer of Mansfield, Bernard and Phylis Studer of Attica, Clem and Marcia Studer of Bucyrus, and Eileen Studer of Bucyrus. He was preceded in death by 3 brothers, Francis, Earl and Gerald Studer and a sister, Florence Cooke.

Calling hours will be on Sunday, January 19, 2003 from 2-4 and 6-8 PM at the Turner Funeral Home, 168 West Main Street, Shelby, where the Rosary will be recited at 7:45 PM. Funeral Mass will be celebrated on Monday at 10:30 AM at Most Pure Heart of Mary Catholic Church with Father Nick Cunningham and Father Clement Alt, CPPS officiating. Burial will be in the parish cemetery. Memorial expressions may be made to St. Mary School Endowment Fund.

Posted in Obituaries | No Comments »

Roger Allan Smith

Wednesday, April 17th, 2013

Roger A. Smith, age 69, of 61 Park Avenue, Shelby, died Sunday, September, 15, 2002 at Hillside Acres Nursing Home in Willard after an extended illness.

He was born June 6, 1933 in Warwick, Ohio, the son of the late William A. and Cleo G. (Leedy) Smith. Roger was a 1952 graduate of Willard High School and served in the Air Force during the Korean Conflict. As a young man, he worked for the B and O Railroad in Willard. He retired from

General Motors in Ontario after 34 years of service. He was a member of the Shelby American Legion O’Brien Post #326 and Golden Rule Lodge #562 F and AM in Willard. Roger was an avid sports fan and enjoyed traveling, woodworking, golf, bowling, and playing cards.

He was a devoted husband, father, and grandfather to: His wife, Rosemary E. (Moomaw) Smith, whom he wed on April 24, 1954; his sons and ispouses: Randall and Leigh Ann Smith of Moorpark, CA, Ronald Smith and Susan Colley-Smith of Dublin, Ryan and Debbie Smith of Dublin; 8 grandchildren: Kristin Smith, Ashley Smith, Randall (Scott) Smith II, Melanie Smith, Kathryn Smith, Samantha Smith, Sarah Smith, Sydney Smith; 2 brothers: William L. Smith of Brandon, FL and Don E. Smith of .Concord, CA.

He was preceded in death by a brother Eugene C. Smith.

Calling hours will be held on Wednesday, September 18, 2002 from 2-4 and 6-8 PM at the Turner Funeral Home, 168 West Main Street, Shelby where Masonic services will be held at 7:00 PM. Funeral services will be held at the funeral home on Thursday at 1:00 PM. Burial will be in Most Pure Heart of Mary Catholic Cemetery with military honors. Memorial expressions may be made to Dept. of Neurology at Ohio State University.

Posted in Obituaries | No Comments »

Cecil J. “Pete” Stickney

Wednesday, April 17th, 2013

Cecil J. Pete Stickney, age 76, of 88 West Park Drive, Shelby, and a resident of Crestwood Care Center for the past year, died Sunday morning, December 7, 2003 at Med Central Shelby Hospital after an extended illness.

Pete was born March 31, 1927 in Shelby, the son of the late Dale and Gail (Billman) Stickney. He was a 1945 graduate of Shelby High School and was the retired owner of the Shelby Beer Dock. He was a member of the Shelby American Legion O’Brien Post #326, Shelby Owls, Shelby Fraternal Order of Eagles Aerie #763, Shelby VFW George Broderick Post #291. He was a Navy veteran of WWII.

He is survived by his daughter and son-in-law, Kathy and Trent Mohn of Shelby; 2 granddaughters and spouse, Krystal and Scott Lovejoy of Cleveland and Jennifer Mohn of Columbus; a sister, Reatha Lake of Shelby; 2 brothers Jack Stickney of Springfield, OH and Kenneth Stickney of Epworth, GA; Nieces and Nephews. Pete was preceded in death by his wife, L. Louise (Hollenbaugh) Stickney in 2001 and by a daughter, Madonna Jean Stickney in 1997.

Friends may call on Tuesday, December 9, 2003 from 6-8 PM at the Turner Funeral Home, 168 West Main Street, Shelby and also on Wednesday from 9:30 AM-10:30 AM , Funeral services will be at 10:30 AM Wednesday at the funeral home with Rev. David Carter, pastor of Trinity United Methodist Church officiating. Burial will be in Oakland Cemetery in Shelby, with military honors conducted by the Shelby American Legion. Memorial expressions may be made to the Trinity United Methodist Church.

Posted in Obituaries | No Comments »

Janet E. “Hooter” (Anderson) Straw

Wednesday, April 17th, 2013

Janet E. Anderson Hooter Straw, age 44, of 22 Marvin Avenue, Shelby, died Tuesday, January 7, 2003 at Med Central Mansfield Hospital after a short illness.

She was born January 15, 1958 in Shelby, the daughter of the late Earl and Jane (Kirkpatrick) Anderson. Janet was a 1976 graduate of Shelby Senior High School and Pioneer Joint Vocational School. She was employed at Interstate Optical in Mansfield and prior to that, Janet was employed by Shelby City Schools. She attended First United Methodist Church. She and her husband Ken provided a home that was welcoming to all. It was always filled with family and friends.

Janet is survived by her husband, Kenneth D. Straw, whom she wed on October 27, 1990 at a Halloween costume celebration; 2 daughters, Janelle L. Straw at home and Amy Harper of Boulder, Colorado; an uncle and aunt, Joe and Eileen Kirkpatrick of Shelby; her mother-in-law, Elvanor Straw of Shelby; 2 sisters-in-law, Lorraine Straw of Grand Rapids, MI and Christine Straw of Milwaukee, WI. She was preceded in death by her brother, Tommy Anderson.

Calling hours will be on Friday, January 10, 2003, from 2-4 and 6-8 PM at the Turner Funeral Home, 168 West Main Street, Shelby. Funeral Services will be conducted on Saturday at 10:00 AM at the First United Methodist Church with Rev. Gail Angel officiating. Burial will be in Oakland Cemetery in Shelby. Memorial expressions may be made to an education fund for her 11-year-old daughter, Janelle in care of the funeral home.

Posted in Obituaries | No Comments »

Rev. Edmund C. Sutter, M.S.C.

Wednesday, April 17th, 2013

The Rev. Edmund C. Sutter, 81, of the Missionaries of the Sacred Heart, who was born in the shadow of Bethlehem’s Catholic Church and grew up to serve as a priest, died at 9:05 a.m. Saturday in Crestline Nursing Home after a one-year illness.

A graduate of John Carroll University in Cleveland, he later attended Scared Heart Seminary in Shelby where he was ordained Feb. 24, 1945 for the Missionaries of the Sacred Heart. He spent his religious life serving parishes in the Reading, PA area, but upon his retirement, returned to his home in Bethlehem where he helped serve at the Sacred Heart of Jesus Catholic Church until his health declined.

Surviving are a brother, Norbert of Crestline; four sisters: Sister Mary Rosalind of Fostoria, Sister Mary Joan of Thousand Oaks, CA, Mrs. Harold (Florence) Hafer of Shelby, and Mrs. Cecilia Gardner of Strongsville; 12 nephews; nine nieces; two sisters-in- law: Mrs. Paul (Ethel) Sutter of Strongsville and Mrs. Charles (Joan) Sutter of Crestline, with whom he resided after his retirement.

He was preceded in death by his parents, Henry E. and Anna C. (Cowl) Sutter; one sister, and two brothers.

A concelebrated Mass of the Resurrection will be conducted 11 a.m. Tuesday at the Sacred Heart of Jesus Catholic Church in Bethlehem. Burial will be in the Sacred Heart Cemetery. Friends may call 2-4 today and 7-9 tonight at the Turner Funeral Home or at the church from 9 a.m. until the time of service Tuesday. Devotions will be held at 8 tonight at the funeral home.

Posted in Obituaries | No Comments »

Thurman J. Stults

Wednesday, April 17th, 2013

Thurman J. Stults, age 71, of 30 Vernon Road, Shelby, died Monday morning in the Crestwood Care Center after an extended illness. He was born August 13, 1918 in Alliance, Ohio, the son of Jacob and Ruth (Stacy) Stults.

Mr. Stults had been employed at the Ohio Seamless Tube until he was inducted into the Army in 1942 during WWII. After his dicharge, he was employed by Mansfield Tire and Rubber Co until he retired in 1977. He was a member of the First Christian Church in Shelby, and Shelby Masonic Lodge No. 350 F. and A.M. and Shelby Chapter No. 178 R.A.M.

He is survived by his wife, Hildred (Brooks) Stults, whom he married on Oct. 13, 1952. 2 brothers: Jack Stults of Moore, Oklahoma, and Richard Stults of Shelby. 5 sisters: Mrs. Ozzie (Betty) Roberts of Shelby, Mrs. Louie (Faye) Olsen of Brookfield WI, Mrs. Robert (Dolores) Ferguson of Alliance, OH, Mrs. Harold (Jane) Becker of Barstow, California, and Fern Thrash of Rialto, California.

He was preceded in death by 1 brother and 1 sister.

Graveside Services will be conducted at 1 P.M. Wednesday at Oakland Cemetery in Shelby by Pastor Rev. C. Reid Miller. Military services will be held at the graveside conducted by the Shelby American Legion. Calling hours will not be observed.

Memorial contributions may be made to the American Heart Association or the American Cancer Society and left at the Turner Funeral Home which is in charge of funeral arrangements.

Posted in Obituaries | No Comments »

Hildred Catherine (Brooks) Stults

Wednesday, April 17th, 2013

Hildred Catherine (Brooks) Stults, age 83, of 30 Vernon Road, Shelby, died Tuesday, August 24, 1999 at Med Central Mansfield Hospital after a 4-month illness.

She was born October 10, 1915 in Arlington, Ohio, the daughter of Harve Sanderson and Hazel Dell (Reedy) Brooks, and was raised in Lebanon, Ohio by her aunt and uncle, Homer and Nellie Reedy. Mrs. Stults was a graduate of Shelby High School. She worked for Max Oxman in Shelby, the Shelby Spring Hinge Company, Doctor James Ellery, and retired from the Medical Records Department at Shelby Memorial Hospital. She was a member of the First Christian Church and the Christian Womens Fellowship.

Mrs. Stults is survived by her sister and brother-in-law, Margaret and Tom Kirkpatrick of Mansfield with whom she had been living since becoming ill; many nieces and nephews including: Jack and

Joy Waddell of San Antonio, TX and Mark and Victoria Kirkpatrick of Brooklyn, OH; a sister-in-law, Pauline Brooks of Clyde, OH.

On October 13, 1952 she married Thurman J. Stults in Angola, IN, and he preceded her in death on February 19, 1990. She was also preceded in death by 3 brothers: Delbert, Donald, and Harvey Brooks.

Graveside services will be on Saturday at 10 AM at Oakland Cemetery in Shelby with Rev. Craig Jones officiating. Memorial expressions may be made to the First Christian Church. The family has chosen the Turner Funeral Home in Shelby to assist them with funeral arrangements.

Posted in Obituaries | No Comments »
